verses.kjv: And these are the countries which the children of Israel inherited in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel, distributed for inheritance to them.
verses.web: These are the inheritances which the children of Israel took in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the tribes of the children of Israel, distributed to them,
verses.ct: Here are the territories the Israelites received as their inheritance in the land of Canaan, distributed by Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leaders of each tribal family.

verses.kjv: By lot was their inheritance, as the LORD commanded by the hand of Moses, for the nine tribes, and for the half tribe.
verses.web: by the lot of their inheritance, as LORD commanded by Moses, for the nine tribes, and for the half-tribe.
verses.ct: Their land was assigned by casting lots, just as the LORD had commanded through Moses, for the 9 and a half tribes.

verses.kjv: For Moses had given the inheritance of two tribes and an half tribe on the other side Jordan: but unto the Levites he gave none inheritance among them.
verses.web: For Moses had given the inheritance of the two tribes and the half-tribe beyond the Jordan; but to the Levites he gave no inheritance among them.
verses.ct: Moses had already given land to 2 and a half tribes on the east side of the Jordan River, but he gave no land inheritance to the Levites.

verses.kjv: For the children of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim: therefore they gave no part unto the Levites in the land, save cities to dwell in, with their suburbs for their cattle and for their substance.
verses.web: For the children of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim. They gave no portion to the Levites in the land, except cities to dwell in, with their pasture lands for their livestock and for their property.
verses.ct: Joseph's descendants had become 2 separate tribes — Manasseh and Ephraim — so the total number of tribes receiving land stayed the same even without the Levites. The Levites received no portion of land, only cities to live in along with surrounding pasturelands for their livestock and property.

verses.kjv: As the LORD commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did, and they divided the land.
verses.web: The children of Israel did as LORD commanded Moses, and they divided the land.
verses.ct: The Israelites followed the LORD's instructions to Moses and divided up the land.

verses.kjv: Then the children of Judah came unto Joshua in Gilgal: and Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite said unto him, Thou knowest the thing that the LORD said unto Moses the man of God concerning me and thee in Kadeshbarnea.
verses.web: Then the children of Judah came near to Joshua in Gilgal. Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him, “You know the thing that LORD spoke to Moses the man of God concerning me and concerning you in Kadesh Barnea.
verses.ct: The people of Judah came to Joshua at Gilgal, and Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite spoke up: "You remember what the LORD told Moses, the man of God, about you and me back at Kadesh Barnea.

verses.kjv: Forty years old was I when Moses the servant of the LORD sent me from Kadeshbarnea to espy out the land; and I brought him word again as it was in mine heart.
verses.web: I was forty years old when Moses the servant of LORD sent me from Kadesh Barnea to spy out the land. I brought him word again as it was in my heart.
verses.ct: I was 40 years old when Moses, the LORD's servant, sent me from Kadesh Barnea to scout out the land. I came back and gave him an honest report — straight from my heart.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless my brethren that went up with me made the heart of the people melt: but I wholly followed the LORD my God.
verses.web: Nevertheless, my brothers who went up with me made the heart of the people melt; but I wholly followed LORD my God.
verses.ct: But the other men who went with me terrified the people and drained their courage. I, however, followed the LORD my God wholeheartedly.

verses.kjv: And Moses sware on that day, saying, Surely the land whereon thy feet have trodden shall be thine inheritance, and thy children’s for ever, because thou hast wholly followed the LORD my God.
verses.web: Moses swore on that day, saying, ‘Surely the land where you walked shall be an inheritance to you and to your children forever, because you have wholly followed LORD my God.’
verses.ct: That same day, Moses made me a solemn promise: 'The land your feet have walked on will belong to you and your descendants forever, because you followed the LORD my God wholeheartedly.'

verses.kjv: And now, behold, the LORD hath kept me alive, as he said, these forty and five years, even since the LORD spake this word unto Moses, while the children of Israel wandered in the wilderness: and now, lo, I am this day fourscore and five years old.
verses.web: “Now, behold, LORD has kept me alive, as he spoke, these forty-five years, from the time that LORD spoke this word to Moses, while Israel walked in the wilderness. Now, behold, I am eighty-five years old, today.
verses.ct: Now look — the LORD has kept me alive just as he promised, all these 45 years since he spoke those words to Moses while Israel wandered in the wilderness. Here I am today, 85 years old!

verses.kjv: As yet I am as strong this day as I was in the day that Moses sent me: as my strength was then, even so is my strength now, for war, both to go out, and to come in.
verses.web: As yet I am as strong today as I was in the day that Moses sent me. As my strength was then, even so is my strength now for war, to go out and to come in.
verses.ct: I'm just as strong today as I was the day Moses sent me out. My strength for battle — for marching out and fighting — is the same now as it was then.

verses.kjv: Now therefore give me this mountain, whereof the LORD spake in that day; for thou heardest in that day how the Anakims were there, and that the cities were great and fenced: if so be the LORD will be with me, then I shall be able to drive them out, as the LORD said.
verses.web: Now therefore give me this hill country, of which LORD spoke in that day; for you heard in that day how the Anakim were there, and great and fortified cities. It may be that LORD will be with me, and I shall drive them out, as LORD said.”
verses.ct: So give me this hill country that the LORD promised me that day. You heard for yourself that the Anakim live there in large, fortified cities. But if the LORD is with me, I will drive them out, just as the LORD said."

verses.kjv: And Joshua blessed him, and gave unto Caleb the son of Jephunneh Hebron for an inheritance.
verses.web: Joshua blessed him; and he gave Hebron to Caleb the son of Jephunneh for an inheritance.
verses.ct: Joshua blessed Caleb and gave him Hebron as his inheritance.

verses.kjv: Hebron therefore became the inheritance of Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite unto this day, because that he wholly followed the LORD God of Israel.
verses.web: Therefore Hebron became the inheritance of Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite to this day, because he followed LORD, the God of Israel wholeheartedly.
verses.ct: That is why Hebron still belongs to Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite to this day — because he followed the LORD, the God of Israel, wholeheartedly.

verses.kjv: And the name of Hebron before was Kirjatharba; which Arba was a great man among the Anakims. And the land had rest from war.
verses.web: Now the name of Hebron before was Kiriath Arba, after the greatest man among the Anakim. Then the land had rest from war.
verses.ct: Hebron used to be called Kiriath Arba, named after Arba, the greatest warrior among the Anakim. After this, the land was at peace from war.
